alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 2:05PM CDT until August 10 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 205 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated slow-moving thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 3 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Oak Hills Place, Merrydale, Brownfields, Westminster, Inniswold, Village St. George, Gardere and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 157 and 163. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 2 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
